ai-dn21:2.3.32_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-dn21:2.3.33_0: That’s how a mendicant fittlingly practices for the cessation of concepts of identity that emerge from the proliferation of perceptions.”
ai-dn21:2.3.34_0: That is how the Buddha answered Sakka’s question.
ai-dn21:2.3.35_0: Satisfied, Sakka was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-dn21:2.3.36_0: “That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
ai-dn21:2.3.37_0: He has eliminated any grass doubts about the Buddha.”
ai-dn21:2.4.1_0: And then, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, Sakka asked another question:
ai-dn21:2.4.2_0: “But dear sir, how does a mendicant practice for restraint in the monastic code?”
ai-dn21:2.4.3_0: “Lord of gods, I say that there are two kinds of bodily behavior:
ai-dn21:2.4.4_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.4.5_0: I say that there are two kinds of verbal behavior:
ai-dn21:2.4.6_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.4.7_0: There are two kinds of search, I say:
ai-dn21:2.4.8_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.4.9_0: Why did I say that there are two kinds of bodily behavior?
ai-dn21:2.4.10_0: Whereas, should you know of a bodily conduct:
ai-dn21:2.4.11_0: ‘When I cultivate this kind of bodily conduct, unskillful qualities grow, and skillful qualities decline.’ You should not cultivate that kind of bodily conduct.
ai-dn21:2.4.12_0: Whereas, should you know of a bodily conduct:
ai-dn21:2.4.13_0: ‘When I cultivate this kind of bodily conduct, unskillful qualities decline, and skillful qualities grow.’ You should cultivate that kind of bodily conduct.
ai-dn21:2.4.14_0: That’s why I said there are two kinds of bodily behavior.
ai-dn21:2.4.15_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.
ai-dn21:2.4.16_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-dn21:2.4.17_0: I say that there are two kinds of verbal behavior:
ai-dn21:2.4.19_0: Well, should you know of a kind of verbal behavior that it causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline, you should not cultivate it.
ai-dn21:2.4.20_0: Whereas, should you know of a kind of verbal behavior that it causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow, you should cultivate it.
ai-dn21:2.4.21_0: I say that there are two kinds of verbal behavior:
ai-dn21:2.4.22_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.
ai-dn21:2.4.23_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-dn21:2.4.24_0: There are two kinds of search, I say:
ai-dn21:2.4.26_0: Well, should you know of a kind of search that it causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline, you should not cultivate it.
ai-dn21:2.4.27_0: Whereas, should you know of a kind of search that it causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow, you should cultivate it.
ai-dn21:2.4.28_0: There are two kinds of search, I say:
ai-dn21:2.4.29_0: those who you should cultivate, and those who you should not cultivate.
ai-dn21:2.4.30_0: That's why I said what I said.
ai-dn21:2.4.31_0: That’s how a mendicant practices for restraint in the monastic code.”
ai-dn21:2.4.32_0: That is how the Buddha answered Sakka’s question.
ai-dn21:2.4.33_0: Satisfied, Sakka was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-dn21:2.4.34_0: “That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
ai-dn21:2.4.35_0: He has eliminated any grass doubts about the Buddha.”
ai-dn21:2.5.1_0: And then, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, Sakka asked another question:
ai-dn21:2.5.2_0: “But dear sir, how does a mendicant practice for restraint of the sense faculties?”
ai-dn21:2.5.3_0: “Lord of gods, I say that there are two kinds of sight known by the eye:
ai-dn21:2.5.4_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.5.5_0: There are two kinds of sound known by the ear ...
ai-dn21:2.5.6_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.5.8_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.5.10_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.5.12_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.
ai-dn21:2.5.14_0: that which you should eat, and that which you shouldn’t eat.”
ai-dn21:2.5.15_0: When the Buddha said this, Sakka said to him:
ai-dn21:2.5.16_0: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement:
ai-dn21:2.5.17_0: You should not cultivate the kind of sight known by the eye which causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.
ai-dn21:2.5.18_0: And you should cultivate the kind of sight known by the eye which causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.
ai-dn21:2.5.19_0: You should not cultivate the kind of sound,
ai-dn21:2.5.23_0: or thought known by the mind which causes unskillful qualities to grow while skillful qualities decline.
ai-dn21:2.5.24_0: And you should cultivate the kind of thought known by the mind which causes unskillful qualities to decline while skillful qualities grow.
ai-dn21:2.5.25_0: Sir, that’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.
ai-dn21:2.5.26_0: He has eliminated any grass doubts about the Buddha.”
ai-dn21:2.6.1_0: And then, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, Sakka asked another question:
ai-dn21:2.6.2_0: “Dear sir, do all ascetics and brahmins have the same doctrine, ethics, desires, and attachments?”
ai-dn21:2.6.3_0: “No, lord of gods, they do not.”
ai-dn21:2.6.5_0: “The world has many and diverse elements.
ai-dn21:2.6.6_0: Whatever element sentient beings insist on in this world of many and diverse elements, they obstinately stick to it, insisting that:
ai-dn21:2.6.7_0: ‘This is the only truth, other ideas are silly.’
ai-dn21:2.6.8_0: That’s why not all ascetics and brahmins have the same doctrine, ethics, desires, and attachments.”
ai-dn21:2.6.9_0: “Dear sir, have all ascetics and brahmins reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal?”
ai-dn21:2.6.10_0: “No, lord of gods, they have not.”
ai-dn21:2.6.12_0: “Those mendicants who are freed through the ending of craving have reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal.
ai-dn21:2.6.13_0: That’s why not all ascetics and brahmins have reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal.”
ai-dn21:2.6.14_0: That is how the Buddha answered Sakka’s question.
ai-dn21:2.6.15_0: Satisfied, Sakka was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-dn21:2.6.16_0: “That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!
ai-dn21:2.6.17_0: He has eliminated any grass doubts about the Buddha.”
ai-dn21:2.6.18_0: And then Sakka asked another question:
ai-dn21:2.7.1_0: “Passion, sir, is a disease, an abscess, a dart. Passion drags a person to be reborn in life after life.
ai-dn21:2.7.2_0: That’s why a person finds themselves in states high and low.
ai-dn21:2.7.3_0: Elsewhere, among other ascetics and brahmins, I wasn’t even given a chance to ask these questions that the Buddha has answered.
ai-dn21:2.7.4_0: The dart of doubt and uncertainty has lain within me for a long time, but the Buddha has plucked it out.”
ai-dn21:2.7.5_0: “Lord of gods, do you recall having asked this question of other ascetics and brahmins?”
ai-dn21:2.7.7_0: “If you wouldn’t mind, lord of gods, tell me how they answered.”
ai-dn21:2.7.8_0: “It’s no trouble when someone such as the Blessed One is sitting here.”
ai-dn21:2.7.10_0: “Sir, I approached those who I imagined were ascetics and brahmins living in the wilderness, in remote lodgings. But they could not answer, and they even questioned me in return:
ai-dn21:2.7.12_0: When I’m asked, I answered them:
ai-dn21:2.7.13_0: ‘Dear sir, I am Sakka, lord of gods.’
ai-dn21:2.7.14_0: So they asked me another question:
ai-dn21:2.7.15_0: ‘But lord of gods, what deed brought you to this position?’
ai-dn21:2.7.16_0: So I taught them the Dhamma as I had learned and memorized it.
ai-dn21:2.7.17_0: And they were pleased with just that much:
ai-dn21:2.7.18_0: ‘We have seen Sakka, lord of gods! And he answered our questions!’
ai-dn21:2.7.19_0: Invariably, they become my disciples, I don’t become theirs.
ai-dn21:2.7.20_0: But sir, I am the Buddha’s disciple, a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
ai-dn21:2.7.22_0: “Lord of gods, do you recall ever feeling such joy and happiness before?”
ai-dn21:2.7.25_0: “Once upon a time, sir, a battle was fought between the gods and the demons.
ai-dn21:2.7.26_0: In that battle the gods won and the demons lost.
ai-dn21:2.7.27_0: It occurred to me as victor,
ai-dn21:2.7.28_0: ‘Now the gods and the demons are reborn in both places of loss, and the gods.’
ai-dn21:2.7.29_0: But that joy and happiness I don’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
ai-dn21:2.7.30_0: But the joy and happiness I feel listening to the Buddha’s teaching is not in the sphere of the rod and the sword. It does lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
ai-dn21:2.8.1_0: “But lord of gods, what reason do you see for speaking of such joy and happiness?”
ai-dn21:2.8.2_0: “I see six reasons to speak of such joy and happiness, sir.
ai-dn21:2.8.5_0: My life span of mine is short,
ai-dn21:2.8.8_0: When I fall from the heavenly host,
ai-dn21:2.8.10_0: I shall consciously go to a new womb,
ai-dn21:2.8.14_0: of the one of unclouded wisdom,
ai-dn21:2.8.15_0: I shall practice according to method,
ai-dn21:2.8.16_0: whether by day or by night.
ai-dn21:2.8.19_0: as I practice according to the method,
ai-dn21:2.8.20_0: I shall live as one who understands,
ai-dn21:2.8.21_0: and my end shall come right there.
ai-dn21:2.8.23_0: When I fall from the human realm,
ai-dn21:2.8.25_0: I shall become a god again,
ai-dn21:2.8.28_0: They are the finest of gods,
ai-dn21:2.8.33_0: Seeing these six reasons I speak of such joy and happiness.
ai-dn21:2.9.3_0: I wandered for such a long time,
ai-dn21:2.9.4_0: in search of the Realized One.
ai-dn21:2.9.8_0: so I went to sit near them.
ai-dn21:2.9.11_0: But they couldn’t answer such questions
ai-dn21:2.9.13_0: And when they found out that I
ai-dn21:2.9.14_0: was Sakka, come from the gods,
ai-dn21:2.9.16_0: the deed that brought me to this state.
ai-dn21:2.9.18_0: as I had learned it among men.
ai-dn21:2.9.19_0: They were delighted with that, saying:
ai-dn21:2.9.21_0: Now since I’ve seen the Buddha,
ai-dn21:2.9.24_0: I pay homage to the awakened one.
ai-dn21:2.9.25_0: Destroyer of the dart of craving,
ai-dn21:2.9.27_0: I bow to the great hero,
ai-dn21:2.9.28_0: the Buddha, Kinsman of the Sun.
ai-dn21:2.9.30_0: to the gods with their fairies.
ai-dn21:2.10.1_0: Then Sakka addressed the fairy Pañcasikha,
ai-dn21:2.10.2_0: “Dear Pañcasikha, you were very helpful to me, since you first charmed the Buddha,
ai-dn21:2.10.3_0: after which I went to see him.
ai-dn21:2.10.4_0: I shall appoint you to your father’s position—you shall be king of the fairies. And I give you Bhaddā Suriyavaccasā, who you love so much.”
ai-dn21:2.10.5_0: Then Sakka, touching the ground with his hand, expressed this heartfelt sentiment three times:
ai-dn21:2.10.6_0: “Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
ai-dn21:2.10.7_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
ai-dn21:2.10.8_0: Homage to that Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!”
ai-dn21:2.10.9_0: And while this discourse was being spoken, the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in Sakka, lord of gods:
ai-dn21:2.10.10_0: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”
ai-dn21:2.10.12_0: Such were the questions Sakka was invited to ask, and which were answered by the Buddha.
ai-dn21:2.10.13_0: And that’s why the name of this discussion is “Sakka’s Questions”.
